charts.name: AWS -> Wavefront Data Ingestion Rate
charts.description: This chart shows the rate at which Wavefront is receiving metrics from CloudWatch and other AWS APIs on the left axis and events from CloudTrail on the right axis. If you've just turned on the integration and don't see any data yet, allow 5-10 minutes for data to start flowing. More detail is available in the Wavefront Internal Dashboard.

sources.name: Cloudwatch + other AWS API points
sources.query: sum(align(1m, mean, rate(ts("~externalservices.cloudwatch.points" or "~externalservices.ec2.points"))))

sources.name: CloudTrail Events
sources.query: sum(align(1m, mean, rate(ts("~externalservices.cloudtrail.events")))) * 60

charts.name: Projected Total AWS Spend This Month
charts.description: This chart estimates what your total AWS bill be this month based on what you have spent so far. It will become more accurate over time.  If you don't see any data, see here: https://community.wavefront.com/docs/DOC-1032#jive_content_id_Configuring_Billing_Metrics

sources.name: spendSoFar
sources.query: sum(align(1h, last(ts(aws.billing.estimatedcharges, source=usd and not LinkedAccount="*"))))

sources.name: Project Spend
spendInPastDay
sources.query: align(1h, mmedian(1w, max(0, ${spendSoFar} - lag(1d, ${spendSoFar}))))

sources.name: daysLeftInMonth
sources.query: align(1h, ${daysInMonth} - day("UTC"))

charts.name: Total On Demand
charts.description: Total number of running on-demand instances. Note: aws.instance.price is a custom metric created by the Wavefront AWS integration. aws.instance.price is the on-demand price of each running instance.

sources.name: OnDemand
sources.query: if(exists(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=normal)) as metric) , count($metric), 0)

charts.name: Total Spot
charts.description: Total number of running spot instances. Note: aws.instance.price is a custom metric created by the Wavefront AWS integration. aws.instance.price is the on demand price of each running instance.

sources.name: instances
sources.query: if(exists(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=spot))) as metric, count($metric), 0)

charts.name: Running Instances by AZ
charts.description: The number of running on demand and spot instances broken out by availability zone. You may see a warning message if you don't use either spot or on demand instances but it is safe to ignore. Note: aws.instance.price is a custom metric created by the Wavefront AWS integration. aws.instance.price is the on demand price of each running instance.

sources.name: Ondemand
sources.query: aliasMetric(aliasSource(count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=normal)), availabilityZone), tagk, availabilityZone, "(.*)", "$1"), "OnDemand")

sources.name: Spot
sources.query: aliasMetric(aliasSource(count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=spot)), availabilityZone), tagk, availabilityZone, "(.*)", "$1"), "Spot")

charts.name: Running Instances by Type
charts.description: Running on demand and spot instances broken out by instance type. You may see a warning message if you don't use either spot or on demand instances but it is safe to ignore. Note: aws.instance.price is a custom metric created by the Wavefront AWS integration. aws.instance.price is the on demand price of each running instance.

sources.name: Ondemand
sources.query: aliasMetric(aliasSource(count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=normal)), instanceType), tagk, instanceType, "(.*)", "$1"), "OnDemand")

sources.name: Spot
sources.query: aliasMetric(aliasSource(count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, instanceLifecycle=spot)), instanceType), tagk, instanceType, "(.*)", "$1"), "Spot")

charts.name: AWS Spending by Service
charts.description: The aws.ebs.volumesize is a custom metric created by Wavefront by calling the describeVolume API.

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: avg(align(1m, mean, last(12h, ts(aws.billing.estimatedcharges and not source=usd))), ServiceName, Currency, accountId)

charts.name: Avg On Demand Price per Instance Class
charts.description: Wavefront includes AWS pricing information as sample metrics.

sources.name: data
sources.query: align(5m, last(2h, taggify(ts(~sample.aws.ec2.on-demand.price.hourly, operatingSystem=Linux), tagk, instanceType, class, 0)))

sources.name: price per instance class
sources.query: avg(${data}, class)

charts.name: p90 CPU Usage by Region
charts.description: Wavefront provides many different functions, including percentiles, as shown in this chart.

sources.name: p90 CPU Utilization by Region
sources.query: percentile(90, align(1m, mean, ts(aws.ec2.cpuutilization.average, InstanceId="*")), Region)

charts.name: Lambda Errors
charts.description: This chart shows the total number of errors across all Lambda functions in the current time window of the chart/dashboard.

sources.name: Errors
sources.query: integral(sum(ts("aws.lambda.errors.sum", not FunctionName=* and Region=*)))

charts.name: ELB Responses by Code
charts.description: This chart uses taggify() to extract the response code (2xx, 3xx, 4xx or 5xx) from the CloudWatch metric name and then aggregates by that tag.

sources.name: data
sources.query: align(1m, mean, taggify(default(24h,1m,0,ts("aws.elb.httpcode_backend_*xx", LoadBalancerName="*" and AvailabilityZone="*")), metric, responseCode, 2, "_"))

sources.name: reponse
sources.query: avg(${data}, responseCode)

charts.name: CPU Utilization by ECS Service
charts.description: This chart counts the number of detected ECS services. Check out the ECS dashboard for information on how to collect much more detailed metrics from ECS than those provided by CloudWatch.

sources.name: Services
sources.query: align(6m,last(1h, ts("aws.ecs.cpuutilization")))

charts.name: DynamoDB Avg Req Latency
charts.description: Moving functions allow you to calculate trends in your data.

sources.name: avg Latency
sources.query: mavg(1w, avg(ts("aws.dynamodb.successfulrequestlatency")))

charts.name: Redshift Connections
charts.description: This chart shows the number of database connections to a cluster.

sources.name: connections
sources.query: align(1m, mean, ts("aws.redshift.databaseconnections", not NodeID="*"))

valuesToReadableStrings.Label: ${mon} = 1 or ${mon} = 3 or ${mon} = 5 or ${mon} = 7 or ${mon} = 8 or ${mon} = 10 or ${mon} = 12
